results.title: The Lama of Greystanes
results.brief_description:
Zatul Rinzin Rinpoche is the 11th reincarnation of the lama (or spiritual leader) of the highest monastery in the world, Rongbuk, which lies at the foot of Mount Everest in western Tibet.
In 1959, when the Chinese invaded Tibet, Rinzin was forced to flee his homeland. Now 57, he lives in Greystanes in the outer western suburbs of Sydney with his wife and three children.
Rinzin is no longer a monk but he is still a lama - a responsibility he must hold his entire life. He now works as a security guard to support himself, his family and his monastery back in Tibet.

results.title: Grey
results.creator_credit: Kelly Schilling, Joe Weatherstone, Steven McGregor and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Aboriginal couple Annika and Randle have very different ideas on how to approach the Sydney Harbour Bridge reconciliation march between black and white Australians. Annika thinks that they should be up there on that bridge showing their support while Randle prefers to show his support on a smaller, more personal scale.
After the march a white woman collapses and, while Randle is off calling for an ambulance, Annika stays with the woman. It is here that she is forced to confront her own prejudice and ultimately acknowledge that she just may be one of the biggest hypocrites of all.
Cast: Janine Matthews, Laurence Clifford, Victoria Longley
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kelly Schilling, Joe Weatherstone, Steven McGregor and AFTRS

results.title: Grace
results.creator_credit: Alice Addison, Isabel Perez, Damien Power and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A lonely girl left looking after the family motel finds her life is about to change when a sophisticated and elegant woman books in for the night.
Cast: Mariel McClovey, Angela Punch McGregor, Tim Richards

results.title: What is art? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Art in Action”.
A parade of the five elements of art: colour, light and dark, line, texture to encourage search for new relationships, experimentation with materials and understanding of these elements in terms of art.

results.title: Light and dark
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Art in Action”.
Studies light and shadow, and graduations of color to illustrate the meaning of values in art. Encourages children to find out, by experimentation with light and dark objects, what value is, what it does, and how it makes them feel.

results.title: The Good Fight
results.creator_credit: Citt Williams, Beck Cole and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
The good fight is a documentary film about masculinity in a modern world, spirituality and the lore of the boxing ring. Set in Dulwich Hill, Sydney’s inner west, the film delves into the gritty existence of a local ‘Fight Club’ led by an unlikely character, Rev. Dave Smith. The story evolves around Rev. Dave’s relationships with the young people who frequent the Fight Club. Includes interviews with Jared Tekaki, Craig (Shorty) Sutton, Shaun Joyce and Alex Tui.
Contains some b&w images.

results.title: Form
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Art in Action”.
Explains that the character of an object is revealed through its form, and encourages children to explore the many different shapes to be found among everyday objects in order to develop an awareness of the importance of form in the structure of art.

results.title: Gods Bones
results.creator_credit: Catherine Sinclair, Samantha Lang and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Angie is pregnant but who is the father? Is it the taxi-driver, the businessman, the actor or the medical student? The potential fathers-to-be are all in for an unexpected mail delivery - a letter with an unusual little parcel. A reminder of what could have been. Based on a short story by Yasunari Kawabata.
Cast: Olivia Pigeot, Brian Vriends, Bogdan Koga, Ritchie Singer, Kiri Paramore

results.title: Texture (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Art in Action”
Studies in hard, rough, soft, smooth surfaces provide a tangible approach to understanding textural qualities in art. Points out the various textural effects which can be achieved with clay, metals, paper, linoleum, and other art materials.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Art in Action”
Studies in hard, rough, soft, smooth surfaces provide a tangible approach to understanding textural qualities in art. Points out the various textural effects which can be achieved with clay, metals, paper, linoleum, and other art materials.
